Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the difference in tax rates between Wall Street hedge fund managers and sheet metal workers or school teachers.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide specific evidence or data to support the statement that hedge fund managers pay a lower tax rate than sheet metal workers or school teachers.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that all Wall Street hedge fund managers pay a lower tax rate than sheet metal workers or school teachers, without considering individual circumstances or tax laws.
Exist alternative explanation: There could be alternative explanations for any perceived difference in tax rates, such as differing income levels or tax deductions available to different professions.
